StoryText: My boss %FullName:NPC:1% wants to go to lunch with me but %Pron:1:1% eats terribly and I want to eat healthy.
Question: What should I do?

OptionText.Text: Suggest we eat at the healthy restaurant that I like.
Let my boss choose the restaurant.
Choose a restaurant that has healthy and unhealthy options.

OptionResult.Result: I enjoy my food but %FullName:NPC:1% is upset because %Pron:1:1% doesn't want healthy food. %Pron:1:1% wants something greasy. But at least I can focus the rest of the work day.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: %FullName:NPC:1% is mad that I picked this place, but I really thought there would be something %Pron:1:1% would enjoy. I guess not. Well, we ate healthy and I have a productive rest of my day, even if %FullName:NPC:1% is angry at me for "ruining lunch."

OptionResult.Result: %FullName:NPC:1% chooses a terribly unhealthy restaurant and everything on the menu is greasy and terrible. It tastes great, but I feel awful after.
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: %FullName:NPC:1% is happy I let %Pron:1:2% pick because %Pron:1:1% knows I would've picked a different place if I was making the choice. So, I'm glad to have a solid relationship with my boss. But oh, I feel so awful now. Where are the antacids??

OptionResult.Result: This ends up being a good compromise. %FullName:NPC:1% gets some greasy, unhealthy dish and I get something pretty healthy! But it's so expensive!
OptionResult.DiaryEntry: Well, %FullName:NPC:1% and I are good after this choice. We both got the food we wanted. And I feel great after eating my healthy dish. But that restaurant was expensive! Wow, was it worth it to keep my boss happy?
